info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 09 at 8:44PM EDT by NWS Albany
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Berkshire, northeastern Columbia and southern Rensselaer Counties through 930 PM EDT... At 843 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Lenox, or 8 miles southwest of Pittsfield, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Heavy rains could cause flooding. Locations impacted include... Pittsfield, Chatham, Nassau, Lee, Lenox, Stephentown, New Lebanon, Austerlitz, Hancock, New Ashford, Berkshire, Ghent, Lanesborough, Stockbridge, Canaan, Richmond, West Stockbridge, East Nassau, Brookview and Van Hoesen Station. This includes Interstate 90 near exit 10. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
